story.text: Wander. Make note of surprises along the way.
Lasting changes in behavior grow from tiny habits. This is how we will grow our garden. See [[Tiny Habits]].
The first thing I do is “de-stream” articles. I extract a reusable piece that it can be connected to many different things eventually. I make a home for this idea or fact.
Mike Caulfield contrasted these metaphors of Garden and Stream. See [[A Year in the Garden]].
Sometimes I paraphrase. Sometimes the paraphrasing comes much later than the initial find. I collect bookmarks and insight. I connect things as I notice connections.
Wiki offers new affordances to the practice of a [[Commonplace Book]].

item.text: Wander. Make note of surprises along the way.
We will grow our garden with [[Tiny Habits]].

The first thing I do is “de-stream” the article. The article is about Oregon, but I want to extract a reusable piece out of it in a way that it can be connected to many different things eventually. I want to make a home page for this idea or fact.
The first thing I do is “de-stream” articles. I extract a reusable piece that it can be connected to many different things eventually. I make a home for this idea or fact.
Sometimes I paraphrase. Sometimes the paraphrasing comes much later than the initial find. I collect bookmarks and insight. I connect things as I notice connections.
Mike Caulfield contrasted these metaphors of Garden and Stream. See [[A Year in the Garden]].
Lasting changes in behavior grow from tiny habits. This is how we will grow our garden. See [[Tiny Habits]].
Wiki offers new affordances to the practice of a [[Commonplace Book]].
